title: Gene Explorer Tour
description: Focus on gene‑level features: ORFs, start/stop codons, and protein‑coding regions.

steps.title: Genes on the map
steps.content: The gene map shows predicted genes on forward (top) and reverse (bottom) strands.

steps.title: Jump to a gene
steps.content: Click a gene region in the map to jump the sequence viewer to that position.

steps.title: Reading an ORF
steps.content: An ORF (open reading frame) is a stretch of DNA that can be translated into a protein. Look for long regions without stop codons in a frame.

steps.title: Start and stop codons
steps.content: Start codons (usually ATG) mark translation start; stop codons (TAA/TAG/TGA) terminate translation. In Amino Acids view, stops appear as *.

steps.title: Reading frames matter
steps.content: Switch to Amino Acids and press f to cycle frames. A real gene will show a coherent protein in one frame and nonsense in others.

steps.title: Protein properties
steps.content: Amino acids are colored by chemistry (hydrophobic, polar, acidic, basic). Patterns can hint at membrane proteins or enzymes.

steps.title: Codon usage
steps.content: Use the command palette (:) to open Codon Usage or Bias overlays. Skewed usage can indicate host adaptation or horizontal transfer.
